Procs

proc parseAny[T](value: JsonNode): T
proc addRequest(request: string; callback: proc (values: JsonNode): string;
                jsSignature = "value") {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
This will register a function "callback" that can run on back-end. "addRequest" will be performed with "value" each time the javascript client calls: window.ui.backend(request, value, function(response) {...}) with the specific "request" value. There are also overloaded functions for less or additional parameters There is a wrapper for python, C and C++ to handle strings in each specific programming language Notice for python: There is no check for correct function signature! 
proc addRequest_argc_argv_rstr(crequest: cstring; callback: proc (argc: cint;
    argv: cstringArray): cstring {...}{.cdecl.}; freeFunc: proc (value: pointer) {...}{.
    cdecl.} = free_c) {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1", raises: [], tags: [RootEffect].}
proc addRequest[T1, R](request: string; callback: proc (value1: T1): R)
proc addRequest[T1, T2, R](request: string;
                           callback: proc (value1: T1; value2: T2): R)
proc addRequest[T1, T2, T3, R](request: string; callback: proc (value1: T1;
    value2: T2; value3: T3): R)

    value2: T2; value3: T4; value4: T4): R)

    value1: T1; value2: T2; value3: T4; value4: T4; value5: T5): R)

proc getCallbackFunc(request: string): proc (values: JsonNode): string {...}{.
    raises: [ServerException, ReqUnknownException], tags: [].}
proc enableStorage() {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1",
                       raises: [Exception, ServerException], tags: [
    ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}
Registers "getStoredVal" and "setStoredVal" as requests Use "backend.setStoredVal(key, x)" to store a value persistent in "storage.json" Use "backend.getStoredVal(key)" in js to read a stored value 
proc addRequest(request: string;
                callback: proc (valuesdef: varargs[PPyObject]): string) {...}{.
    raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
proc enableRequestLogger() {...}{.raises: [Exception, IOError],
                             tags: [RootEffect, ReadDirEffect].}
Start to log all requests with content, even passwords, into file "requests.log". The file can be used for automated tests, to archive and replay all actions. 
proc disableRequestLogger() {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Will stop to log to "requests.log" (default) 
proc setUseServer(val: bool) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
If true, use Http Server instead of Webview. 
proc setUseGlobalToken(val: bool) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
The global token is a weak session-free CSRF check. Still much better than no CSRF protection. Per default enabled in release mode. If false, deactivate global token in release mode. 
proc dispatchRequest(request: string; value: string): string {...}{.
    raises: [Exception, ServerException, ReqUnknownException],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Global string dispatcher that will trigger a previously registered functions 
proc dispatchRequest(request, value: cstring): cstring {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1",
    raises: [Exception, ServerException, ReqUnknownException],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
proc dispatchJsonRequest(jsonMessage: JsonNode): string {...}{.
    raises: [KeyError, Exception, ServerException, ReqUnknownException],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Global json dispatcher that will be called from webview AND httpserver This will extract specific values that were prepared by nimview.js and forward those values to the string dispatcher. 
proc selectFolderDialog(title: string): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Will open a "sect folder dialog" if in webview mode and return the selection. Will return emptys string in webserver mode 
proc selectFileDialog(title: string): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Will open a "sect file dialog" if in webview mode and return the selection. Will return emptys string in webserver mode 
proc dispatchCommandLineArg(escapedArgv: string): string {...}{.raises: [Exception],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}
Will handle previously logged request json and forward those to registered functions.

    exportc: "nimview_$1", raises: [Exception],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}
proc readAndParseJsonCmdFile(filename: string) {...}{.raises: [Exception, IOError],
    tags: [ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Will open, parse a file of previously logged requests and re-runs those requests. 
proc readAndParseJsonCmdFile(filename: cstring) {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1",
    raises: [Exception, IOError],
    tags: [ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
proc dispatchHttpRequest(jsonMessage: JsonNode; headers: HttpHeaders): string {...}{.raises: [
    KeyError, ValueError, CatchableError, Exception, ServerException,
    ReqUnknownException, ReqDeniedException], tags: [RootEffect].}
Modify this, if you want to add some authentication, input format validation or if you want to process HttpHeaders. 
proc startHttpServer(indexHtmlFile: string = defaultIndex; port: int = 8000;
                     bindAddr: string = "localhost") {...}{.
    raises: [OSError, IOError, Exception, ValueError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Start Http server in blocking mode. indexHtmlFile will displayed for "/". Files in parent folder or sub folders may be accessed without further check. Will run forever. 
proc startHttpServer(indexHtmlFile: cstring; port: int = 8000;
                     bindAddr: cstring = "localhost") {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1",
    raises: [OSError, IOError, Exception, ValueError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
proc stopHttpServer() {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1", raises: [], tags: [].}
Will stop the Http server - will not wait for stop 
proc stopDesktop() {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1", raises: [Exception],
                     tags: [RootEffect].}
Will stop the Desktop app - may trigger application exit. 
proc startDesktop(indexHtmlFile: string = defaultIndex;
                  title: string = "nimview"; width: int = 640;
                  height: int = 480; resizable: bool = true;
                  debug: bool = defined(release)) {...}{.raises: [OSError, IOError,
    Exception, KeyError, ValueError, JsonParsingError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Will start Webview Desktop UI to display the index.hmtl file in blocking mode. 
proc startDesktop(indexHtmlFile: cstring; title: cstring = "nimview";
                  width: cint = 640; height: cint = 480; resizable: cint = 1;
                  debug: cint = 0) {...}{.exportc: "nimview_$1", raises: [OSError,
    IOError, Exception, KeyError, ValueError, JsonParsingError], tags: [
    ReadIOEffect, ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
proc start(indexHtmlFile: string = defaultIndex; port: int = 8000;
           bindAddr: string = "localhost"; title: string = "nimview";
           width: int = 640; height: int = 480; resizable: bool = true) {...}{.raises: [
    OSError, IOError, Exception, ValueError, KeyError, JsonParsingError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Tries to automatically select the Http server in debug mode or when no UI available and the Webview Desktop App in Release mode, if UI available. The debug mode information will not be available for python or dll. 
proc start(indexHtmlFile: cstring; port: cint = 8000;
           bindAddr: cstring = "localhost"; title: cstring = "nimview";
           width: cint = 640; height: cint = 480; resizable: cint = 1) {...}{.
    exportc: "nimview_$1", raises: [OSError, IOError, Exception, ValueError,
                                    KeyError, JsonParsingError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, ReadDirEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
